question: You are given a dipole of charge +q and -q separated by a distance 2R. A sphere 'A' of radius 'R' passes through the centre of the dipole as shown below and another sphere 'B' of radius '2R' passes through the charge +q. Then the electric flux through the sphere A is
images/a1b2c3d4-0017-4000-8000-000000000017.png
explanation: According to the diagram and description:
Sphere A of radius R passes through the center of the dipole. The dipole length is 2R, so the center to either charge is R.
Sphere A is centered at -q (based on standard interpretation of such diagrams where A encloses one charge).
If A encloses -q, by Gauss's Law, Flux <katex>$\phi = \frac{q_{enclosed}}{\epsilon_0} = \frac{-q}{\epsilon_0}$</katex>.
